citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection an employee was seen improperly handling a juvenile kangaroo during feeding. The inspector
observed the nursing joey was being held horizontally on its back, which is contraindicated for feeding this species.
Improper positioning of the animal while feeding milk replacement formula to marsupials can lead to aspiration and
accompanying aspiration pneumonia.
Additionally, in a video posted to social media, a clip showed 10+ persons free roaming inside the sloth exhibit. There was
excessive noise caused by loud speaking volumes of both children and adults. Loud noises are known to cause stress in
sloths. An exhibited sloth was shown to be grabbing with its claws towards a person’s repeated finger pointing and nearly
touching the sloth. The sloth was attempting to bite with an open mouth, and its hair was “puffed up,” as mentioned by the
filmmaker. The filmmaker was also pointing and moving their hand towards the sloth. Sloth behaviors such as these can
be indicative of behavioral stress and discomfort and could potentially harm members of the public.
Handling of all animals shall be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause behavioral stress, physical
harm, or unnecessary discomfort. Correct by 5/12/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
